io.elimu.a2d2.helpers

Class WIHInvoker

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.elimu.a2d2.helpers.WIHInvoker

  • public class WIHInvoker
extends java.lang.Object
    WIHInvoker is used to call WorkItemHandlers that you have configured for the processes, from the rules.
    You can invoke different Work Item Managers using the WorkDefinition's name you have under TaskName in your service tasks. As long as you pass the expected inputs, you will receive the result of invoking it. Here's a short example for CallREST:
    java.util.Map params = new java.util.HashMap();
    params.put("url", "https://google.com");
    params.put("method", "GET");
    java.util.Map results = io.elimu.a2d2.helpers.WIHInvoker.invoke(drools, "CallREST", params);
    ServiceResponse resp = (ServiceResponse) results.get("serviceResponse");
    There is a similar variance for invokeDyn(KnowledgeHelper, String, Object...) where you would pass the parameters directly as method parameters instead of a map. Be sure for that variation to always pass an even number of parameters, like this:
    java.util.Map results = io.elimu.a2d2.helpers.WIHInvoker.invokeDyn(drools, "CallREST", "url", "https://google.com", "method", "GET");
    ServiceResponse resp = (ServiceResponse) results.get("serviceResponse");

    • Method Detail

      • invokeDyn

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> invokeDyn(KnowledgeHelper helper,
                                                                         java.lang.String wihName,
                                                                         java.lang.Object... params)
        Invokes a work item handler, parameters passed as dynamic parameters
        Parameters:
        helper - A parameter you always have available in DRL under the keyword "drools"
        wihName - the WorkItemHandler definition name, to identify which WorkItemHandler contract to adhere to.
        params - A list of parameters, first containing a key, then a value, for each parameter to be passed to the WIH.
        Returns:
        The result map from invoking the work item handler.
        Throws:
        BaseException - if the WorkItemHandler invoked is not auto completed. If it needs an external interaction to finish, this call won't work

      • invoke

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> invoke(KnowledgeHelper helper,
                                                                      java.lang.String wihName,
                                                                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> params)
        Invokes a work item handler, parameters passed as a Map
        Parameters:
        helper - A parameter you always have available in DRL under the keyword "drools"
        wihName - the WorkItemHandler definition name, to identify which WorkItemHandler contract to adhere to.
        params - A Map with the parameters to be passed to the WIH.
        Returns:
        The result map from invoking the work item handler.
        Throws:
        BaseException - if the WorkItemHandler invoked is not auto completed. If it needs an external interaction to finish, this call won't work
